JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
The Project

We are looking for a carpenter to support us in the building of Køge University Hospital. As Carpenter you will be working on a range of tasks and truly take part in an extensive project.

The job will include duties such as

  • Read and interpret blueprints, technical drawings, and specifications to plan and execute construction tasks.
  • Measure, cut, shape, and assemble wood, plastic, and other building materials according to specifications.
  • Build and install frameworks, including partitions, joists, studding, and rafters.
  • Install windows, doors, and frames, ensuring accurate alignment and functionality.
  • Repair, maintain, and renovate existing structures as required.
  • Collaborate with other tradespeople (e.g., electricians, plumbers) to ensure project completion.
  • Use hand tools and power tools efficiently and safely.
  • Ensure projects comply with local building codes, safety regulations, and company standards.
  • Work efficiently under tight deadlines while maintaining high-quality workmanship.
  • Assist in other construction-related duties as needed.

What we are looking for:

A Carpenter to join us with these characteristics:

  • Proven experience as a Carpenter in construction or a related field.
  • Strong understanding of carpentry techniques, tools, and materials.
  • Ability to read blueprints, technical documents, and construction plans.
  • Proficient in using hand and power tools.
  • Strong attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality work.
  • Good physical condition and stamina to lift heavy materials and work in various weather conditions.
  • Knowledge of safety standards and compliance regulations.

Qualifications:

  • Work experience as a carpenter

What we offer:

  • Insight into a multicultural and multilingual Company;
  • Salary according to the current collective agreement;

If you think you have the right skills to be part of this great project in an exciting international environment, please do not hesitate to send us your application.

About Køge Hospital Project Team I/S (KHPT):


KHPT is a joint venture between Itinera and CMB, two Italian companies with experience in building hospitals.

The Køge Hospital Project is an expansion of the already existing University Hospital in Køge, which will include a complete renovation. When the renovation is complete, it will open to extended special departments, along with new departments for research, which will gather Zealand University Hospital under one single roof. When the work is finished the hospital will be 195.000 sq.m.

details.FormattedPurpose:
The Project

We are looking for a carpenter to support us in the building of Køge University Hospital. As Carpenter you will be working on a range of tasks and truly take part in an extensive project.

The job will include duties such as

  • Read and interpret blueprints, technical drawings, and specifications to plan and execute construction tasks.
  • Measure, cut, shape, and assemble wood, plastic, and other building materials according to specifications.
  • Build and install frameworks, including partitions, joists, studding, and rafters.
  • Install windows, doors, and frames, ensuring accurate alignment and functionality.
  • Repair, maintain, and renovate existing structures as required.
  • Collaborate with other tradespeople (e.g., electricians, plumbers) to ensure project completion.
  • Use hand tools and power tools efficiently and safely.
  • Ensure projects comply with local building codes, safety regulations, and company standards.
  • Work efficiently under tight deadlines while maintaining high-quality workmanship.
  • Assist in other construction-related duties as needed.

What we are looking for:

A Carpenter to join us with these characteristics:

  • Proven experience as a Carpenter in construction or a related field.
  • Strong understanding of carpentry techniques, tools, and materials.
  • Ability to read blueprints, technical documents, and construction plans.
  • Proficient in using hand and power tools.
  • Strong attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality work.
  • Good physical condition and stamina to lift heavy materials and work in various weather conditions.
  • Knowledge of safety standards and compliance regulations.

Qualifications:

  • Work experience as a carpenter

What we offer:

  • Insight into a multicultural and multilingual Company;
  • Salary according to the current collective agreement;

If you think you have the right skills to be part of this great project in an exciting international environment, please do not hesitate to send us your application.

About Køge Hospital Project Team I/S (KHPT):


KHPT is a joint venture between Itinera and CMB, two Italian companies with experience in building hospitals.

The Køge Hospital Project is an expansion of the already existing University Hospital in Køge, which will include a complete renovation. When the renovation is complete, it will open to extended special departments, along with new departments for research, which will gather Zealand University Hospital under one single roof. When the work is finished the hospital will be 195.000 sq.m.
